HWMgmdCtlMsgState.description: The PIM control message state. valid(1) The valid IGMP/MLD control message has been received. invalid(2) The invalid IGMP/MLD control message has been received. ignore(3) The IGMP/MLD control message has been ignored.
HWMgmdCtlMsgState.name: HWMgmdCtlMsgState

hwMgmdCtlMsgCountALLOW.description: The number of IGMP/MLD allow on this interface.
hwMgmdCtlMsgCountALLOW.name: hwMgmdCtlMsgCountALLOW

hwMgmdCtlMsgCountBLOCK.description: The number of IGMP/MLD block on this interface.
hwMgmdCtlMsgCountBLOCK.name: hwMgmdCtlMsgCountBLOCK

hwMgmdCtlMsgCountEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) representing an interface on which IGMP or MLD is enabled. Dynamically created row state is non-volatile, and upon agent reboot should be reinstantiated as a conceptual row. Any change in read-create objects should therefore be backed up by stable storage.
hwMgmdCtlMsgCountEntry.name: hwMgmdCtlMsgCountEntry

hwMgmdCtlMsgCountISEX.description: The number of IGMP/MLD is_ex on this interface.
hwMgmdCtlMsgCountISEX.name: hwMgmdCtlMsgCountISEX

hwMgmdCtlMsgCountISIN.description: The number of IGMP/MLD is_in on this interface.
hwMgmdCtlMsgCountISIN.name: hwMgmdCtlMsgCountISIN

hwMgmdCtlMsgCountIfIndex.description: The ifIndex value of the interface for which IGMP or MLD is enabled. The table is indexed by the ifIndex value and the InetAddressType to allow for interfaces which may be configured in both IPv4 and IPv6 modes.
hwMgmdCtlMsgCountIfIndex.name: hwMgmdCtlMsgCountIfIndex

hwMgmdCtlMsgCountLeaveASM.description: The number of IGMP/MLD leave with ASM group on this interface.
hwMgmdCtlMsgCountLeaveASM.name: hwMgmdCtlMsgCountLeaveASM

hwMgmdCtlMsgCountLeaveSSM.description: The number of IGMP/MLD leave with ASM group on this interface.
hwMgmdCtlMsgCountLeaveSSM.name: hwMgmdCtlMsgCountLeaveSSM

hwMgmdCtlMsgCountOthers.description: The number of total IGMP/MLD others packet on this interface.
hwMgmdCtlMsgCountOthers.name: hwMgmdCtlMsgCountOthers

hwMgmdCtlMsgCountQuerierType.description: The address type of this interface. This entry along with the ifIndex value acts as the index to the hwMgmdRouterInterface table. A physical interface may be configured in multiple modes concurrently, e.g. in IPv4 and IPv6 modes connected to the same interface, however the traffic is considered to be logically separate.
hwMgmdCtlMsgCountQuerierType.name: hwMgmdCtlMsgCountQuerierType

hwMgmdCtlMsgCountQuery.description: The number of IGMP/MLD Query on this interface.
hwMgmdCtlMsgCountQuery.name: hwMgmdCtlMsgCountQuery

hwMgmdCtlMsgCountReportASM.description: The number of IGMP/MLD report with ASM group on this interface.
hwMgmdCtlMsgCountReportASM.name: hwMgmdCtlMsgCountReportASM

hwMgmdCtlMsgCountReportSSM.description: The number of IGMP/MLD report with SSM group on this interface.
hwMgmdCtlMsgCountReportSSM.name: hwMgmdCtlMsgCountReportSSM

hwMgmdCtlMsgCountSrcRecTotal.description: The number of total IGMP/MLD source record on this interface.
hwMgmdCtlMsgCountSrcRecTotal.name: hwMgmdCtlMsgCountSrcRecTotal

hwMgmdCtlMsgCountTOEX.description: The number of IGMP/MLD to_ex on this interface.
hwMgmdCtlMsgCountTOEX.name: hwMgmdCtlMsgCountTOEX

hwMgmdCtlMsgCountTOIN.description: The number of IGMP/MLD to_in on this interface.
hwMgmdCtlMsgCountTOIN.name: hwMgmdCtlMsgCountTOIN

hwMgmdCtlMsgCountTable.description: The (conceptual) table used to list the control message counter on all the interfaces on which IGMP or MLD is enabled.
hwMgmdCtlMsgCountTable.name: hwMgmdCtlMsgCountTable

hwMgmdGMPGlobalLimit.description: This object indicates that the number of global IGMP or MLD entries of the instance reaches the upper limit. This trap message is generated when IGMP or MLD fails to create membership because the number of global IGMP or MLD entries of the instance reaches the upper limit.
hwMgmdGMPGlobalLimit.name: hwMgmdGMPGlobalLimit

hwMgmdGMPGlobalLimitClear.description: This object indicates that the number of global IGMP or MLD entries of the instance falls blow the upper limit. This trap message is generated when IGMP or MLD delete an entry resulting in the number of global IGMP or MLD entries of the instance falls below the upper limit.
hwMgmdGMPGlobalLimitClear.name: hwMgmdGMPGlobalLimitClear

hwMgmdGMPInterfaceLimit.description: This object indicates that the number of IGMP or MLD entries on the interface reaches the upper limit. This trap message is generated when IGMP or MLD fails to create membership because the number of IGMP or MLD entries on the interface reaches the upper limit.
hwMgmdGMPInterfaceLimit.name: hwMgmdGMPInterfaceLimit

hwMgmdGMPInterfaceLimitClear.description: This object indicates that the number of IGMP or MLD entries on the interface falls below the upper limit. This trap message is generated when IGMP or MLD delete an entry resulting in the number of IGMP or MLD entries on the interface falls below the upper limit.
hwMgmdGMPInterfaceLimitClear.name: hwMgmdGMPInterfaceLimitClear

hwMgmdGMPTotalLimit.description: This object indicates that the number of IGMP or MLD entries of all instances reaches the upper limit. This trap message is generated when IGMP or MLD fails to create membership because the number of IGMP or MLD entries of all instances reaches the upper limit.
hwMgmdGMPTotalLimit.name: hwMgmdGMPTotalLimit

hwMgmdGMPTotalLimitClear.description: This object indicates that the number of IGMP or MLD entries of all instances falls below the upper limit. This trap message is generated when IGMP or MLD delete an entry resulting in the number of IGMP or MLD entries of all instances falls below the upper limit.
hwMgmdGMPTotalLimitClear.name: hwMgmdGMPTotalLimitClear

hwMgmdGlobalEntries.description: The total number of IGMP or MLD entries of this instance.
hwMgmdGlobalEntries.name: hwMgmdGlobalEntries

hwMgmdGlobalLimit.description: A hwMgmdGlobalLimit notification signifies that an IGMP report has been limited for up to maximum entries of IGMP global routing-table. This notification is generated whenever an IGMP report failed to create membership as IGMP global routing-table limit.
hwMgmdGlobalLimit.name: hwMgmdGlobalLimit

hwMgmdGmpInterfaceIfIndex.description: The ifIndex value of the interface for which IGMP or MLD is enabled. The table is indexed by the ifIndex value and the InetAddressType to allow for interfaces which may be configured in both IPv4 and IPv6 modes.
hwMgmdGmpInterfaceIfIndex.name: hwMgmdGmpInterfaceIfIndex

hwMgmdGmpInterfaceName.description: The interface name of the interface for which IGMP or MLD is enabled.
hwMgmdGmpInterfaceName.name: hwMgmdGmpInterfaceName

hwMgmdGmpJoin.description: A hwMgmdGmpJoin notification signifies the IGMP or MLD join message was received.
hwMgmdGmpJoin.name: hwMgmdGmpJoin

hwMgmdGmpJoinGrpAddr.description: The IGMP or MLD group address to join.
hwMgmdGmpJoinGrpAddr.name: hwMgmdGmpJoinGrpAddr

hwMgmdGmpJoinSenderIp.description: The host IP address for sending membership report.
hwMgmdGmpJoinSenderIp.name: hwMgmdGmpJoinSenderIp

hwMgmdGmpJoinSrcAddr.description: The IGMP or MLD source address to join.
hwMgmdGmpJoinSrcAddr.name: hwMgmdGmpJoinSrcAddr

hwMgmdGmpJoinVersion.description: The version of MGMD which is running on this interface. Value 1 applies to IGMPv1 and MLDv1 version. Value 2 applies to IGMPv2 and MLDv2 version, and value 3 applies to IGMPv3 version. This object can be used to configure a router capable of running either version. For IGMP and MLD to function correctly, all routers on a LAN must be configured to run the same version on that LAN. This object MAY be modified under any rowstatus condition. ???? DEFVAL { 2 }
hwMgmdGmpJoinVersion.name: hwMgmdGmpJoinVersion

hwMgmdGmpLeave.description: A hwMgmdGmpLeave notification signifies the IGMP or MLD group leaved.
hwMgmdGmpLeave.name: hwMgmdGmpLeave

hwMgmdGmpLimitGroup.description: The multicast group address in the most recently sent IGMP or MLD limit trap. The InetAddressType is defined by the hwMgmdGmpLimitGroupAddressType object.
hwMgmdGmpLimitGroup.name: hwMgmdGmpLimitGroup

hwMgmdGmpLimitGroupAddressType.description: The address type of the multicast group address in the most recently sent IGMP or MLD limit trap. If this router has not sent a limit trap, this object is set to 0.
hwMgmdGmpLimitGroupAddressType.name: hwMgmdGmpLimitGroupAddressType

hwMgmdGmpLimitSource.description: The source address in the most recently sent IGMP or MLD limit trap. The InetAddressType is defined by the hwMgmdGmpLimitGroupAddressType object.
hwMgmdGmpLimitSource.name: hwMgmdGmpLimitSource

hwMgmdHostNotificationGrpAddr.description: The multicast group address in the most recently sent IGMP or MLD proxy limit trap.
hwMgmdHostNotificationGrpAddr.name: hwMgmdHostNotificationGrpAddr

hwMgmdHostNotificationSrcAddr.description: The source address in the most recently sent IGMP or MLD proxy limit trap.
hwMgmdHostNotificationSrcAddr.name: hwMgmdHostNotificationSrcAddr

hwMgmdHostSGCurrentCount.description: The current number of IGMP or MLD proxy (S, G) entries of all instances.
hwMgmdHostSGCurrentCount.name: hwMgmdHostSGCurrentCount

hwMgmdHostSGExceed.description: A hwMgmdHostSGExceed notification signifies that IGMP or MLD proxy (S, G) entries can not be created because the limit of all instances is reached.
hwMgmdHostSGExceed.name: hwMgmdHostSGExceed

hwMgmdHostSGExceedClear.description: A hwMgmdHostSGExceedClear notification signifies that IGMP or MLD proxy (S, G) entries can be created because can be created because the number of IGMP or MLD (S, G) entries of all instances fell below the limit.
hwMgmdHostSGExceedClear.name: hwMgmdHostSGExceedClear

hwMgmdHostSGThreshold.description: The threshold value of IGMP or MLD proxy (S, G)entries uppper limit(%) of all instances.
hwMgmdHostSGThreshold.name: hwMgmdHostSGThreshold

hwMgmdHostSGThresholdExceed.description: A hwMgmdHostSGThresholdExceed notification signifies that IGMP or MLD proxy (S, G) entries count of all instances reached the upper threshold.
hwMgmdHostSGThresholdExceed.name: hwMgmdHostSGThresholdExceed

hwMgmdHostSGThresholdExceedClear.description: A hwMgmdHostSGThresholdExceedClear notification signifies that IGMP or MLD proxy (S, G) entries count of all instances fell below the lower threshold.
hwMgmdHostSGThresholdExceedClear.name: hwMgmdHostSGThresholdExceedClear

hwMgmdHostSGTotalCount.description: The total number of IGMP or MLD proxy (S, G) entries of all instances.
hwMgmdHostSGTotalCount.name: hwMgmdHostSGTotalCount

hwMgmdHostStarGCurrentCount.description: The current number of IGMP or MLD proxy (*, G) entries of all instances.
hwMgmdHostStarGCurrentCount.name: hwMgmdHostStarGCurrentCount

hwMgmdHostStarGExceed.description: A hwMgmdHostStarGExceed notification signifies that IGMP or MLD proxy (*, G) entries can not be created because the limit is reached.
hwMgmdHostStarGExceed.name: hwMgmdHostStarGExceed

hwMgmdHostStarGExceedClear.description: A hwMgmdHostStarGExceedClear notification signifies that IGMP or MLD proxy (*, G) entries can be created because can be created because the number of IGMP or MLD (*, G) entries fell below the limit.
hwMgmdHostStarGExceedClear.name: hwMgmdHostStarGExceedClear

hwMgmdHostStarGThreshold.description: The threshold value of IGMP or MLD proxy (*, G) entries uppper limit(%) of all instances.
hwMgmdHostStarGThreshold.name: hwMgmdHostStarGThreshold

hwMgmdHostStarGThresholdExceed.description: A hwMgmdHostStarGThresholdExceed notification signifies that IGMP or MLD proxy (*, G) entries count of all instances reached the upper threshold.
hwMgmdHostStarGThresholdExceed.name: hwMgmdHostStarGThresholdExceed

hwMgmdHostStarGThresholdExceedClear.description: A hwMgmdHostStarGThresholdExceedClear notification signifies that IGMP or MLD proxy (*, G) entries count of all instances fell below the lower threshold.
hwMgmdHostStarGThresholdExceedClear.name: hwMgmdHostStarGThresholdExceedClear

hwMgmdHostStarGTotalCount.description: The total number of IGMP or MLD proxy (*, G) entries of all instances.
hwMgmdHostStarGTotalCount.name: hwMgmdHostStarGTotalCount

hwMgmdIgmpV1RouterMibCompliance.description: The version statement for routers running IGMPv1, RFC 1112 [4], and implementing the MGMD Mib. MGMDv1 applies to hosts and routers running IGMPv1 only. IGMPv1 routers must support the IPv4 address type
hwMgmdIgmpV1RouterMibCompliance.name: hwMgmdIgmpV1RouterMibCompliance

hwMgmdIgmpV2RouterMibCompliance.description: The version statement for routers running IGMPv2, RFC 2236 [5], and implementing the MGMD Mib. MGMDv2 applies to hosts and routers running IGMPv2 or MLDv1. IGMPv2 routers must support the IPv4 address type
hwMgmdIgmpV2RouterMibCompliance.name: hwMgmdIgmpV2RouterMibCompliance

hwMgmdIgmpV3RouterMibCompliance.description: The version statement for routers running IGMPv3, RFC 3376 [6], and implementing the MGMD Mib. MGMDv3 applies to hosts and routers running IGMPv3 or MLDv2. IGMPv3 routers must support the IPv4 address type.
hwMgmdIgmpV3RouterMibCompliance.name: hwMgmdIgmpV3RouterMibCompliance

hwMgmdInstanceName.description: The instance name of the trap.
hwMgmdInstanceName.name: hwMgmdInstanceName

hwMgmdInterfaceEntries.description: The total number of IGMP or MLD entries on the interface.
hwMgmdInterfaceEntries.name: hwMgmdInterfaceEntries

hwMgmdInterfaceLimit.description: A hwMgmdInterfaceLimit notification signifies that an IGMP report has been limited for up to maximum entries of IGMP interface routing-table. This notification is generated whenever an IGMP report failed to create membership as IGMP interface routing-table limit.
hwMgmdInterfaceLimit.name: hwMgmdInterfaceLimit

hwMgmdInverseRouterCacheAddress.description: The IP multicast group address for which this entry contains information. The InetAddressType, e.g., IPv4 or IPv6, is identified by the hwMgmdInverseRouterCacheAddressType variable in the hwMgmdInverseRouterCache table.
hwMgmdInverseRouterCacheAddress.name: hwMgmdInverseRouterCacheAddress

hwMgmdInverseRouterCacheAddressType.description: The address type of the hwMgmdInverseRouterCacheTable entry.
hwMgmdInverseRouterCacheAddressType.name: hwMgmdInverseRouterCacheAddressType

hwMgmdInverseRouterCacheEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the hwMgmdInverseRouterCacheTable.
hwMgmdInverseRouterCacheEntry.name: hwMgmdInverseRouterCacheEntry

hwMgmdInverseRouterCacheIfIndex.description: The interface for which this entry contains information.
hwMgmdInverseRouterCacheIfIndex.name: hwMgmdInverseRouterCacheIfIndex

hwMgmdInverseRouterCacheTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the interfaces that are members of a particular group. This is an inverse lookup table for entries in the hwMgmdRouterCacheTable.
hwMgmdInverseRouterCacheTable.name: hwMgmdInverseRouterCacheTable

hwMgmdLimitInterfaceIfIndex.description: The interface from which an IGMP or a MLD limit trap is most recently sent. If this router has not sent a limit trap, this object is set to 0.
hwMgmdLimitInterfaceIfIndex.name: hwMgmdLimitInterfaceIfIndex

hwMgmdMibNotificationGroup.description: A collection of notifications for signaling MGMD notification management events.
hwMgmdMibNotificationGroup.name: hwMgmdMibNotificationGroup

hwMgmdMibNotificationObjects.description: A collection of objects to support notification of MGMD notification network management events.
hwMgmdMibNotificationObjects.name: hwMgmdMibNotificationObjects

hwMgmdMldV1RouterMibCompliance.description: The version statement for routers running MLDv1, RFC 2710 [7], and implementing the MGMD Mib. MGMDv2 applies to hosts and routers running IGMPv2 or MLDv1. MLDv1 routers must support the IPv6 address type.
hwMgmdMldV1RouterMibCompliance.name: hwMgmdMldV1RouterMibCompliance

hwMgmdMldV2RouterMibCompliance.description: The version statement for routers running MLDv2 [8] and implementing the MGMD Mib. MGMDv3 applies to hosts and routers running IGMPv3 or MLDv2. MLDv2 routers must support the IPv6 address type.
hwMgmdMldV2RouterMibCompliance.name: hwMgmdMldV2RouterMibCompliance

hwMgmdNotificationAddressType.description: The address type of the multicast group address in the most recently sent IGMP or MLD limit trap.
hwMgmdNotificationAddressType.name: hwMgmdNotificationAddressType

hwMgmdRouterBaseMibGroup.description: The basic collection of objects providing management of MGMD version 1, 2 or 3 for Routers.
hwMgmdRouterBaseMibGroup.name: hwMgmdRouterBaseMibGroup

hwMgmdRouterCacheAddress.description: The IP multicast group address for which this entry contains information. The InetAddressType, e.g., IPv4 or IPv6, is identified by the hwMgmdRouterCacheAddressType variable in the hwMgmdRouterCache table.
hwMgmdRouterCacheAddress.name: hwMgmdRouterCacheAddress

hwMgmdRouterCacheAddressType.description: The address type of the hwMgmdRouterCacheTable entry. This value applies to both the hwMgmdRouterCacheAddress and the hwMgmdRouterCacheLastReporter entries.
hwMgmdRouterCacheAddressType.name: hwMgmdRouterCacheAddressType

hwMgmdRouterCacheEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the hwMgmdRouterCacheTable.
hwMgmdRouterCacheEntry.name: hwMgmdRouterCacheEntry

hwMgmdRouterCacheExcludeModeExpiryTimer.description: This value is applicable only to MGMDv3-compatible nodes and represents the time remaining before the interface EXCLUDE state expires and the interface state transitions to INCLUDE mode. This value can never be greater than hwMgmdRouterCacheExpiryTime.
hwMgmdRouterCacheExcludeModeExpiryTimer.name: hwMgmdRouterCacheExcludeModeExpiryTimer

hwMgmdRouterCacheExpiryTime.description: This value represents the time remaining before the Group Membership Interval state expires. The value must always be greater than or equal to 1.
hwMgmdRouterCacheExpiryTime.name: hwMgmdRouterCacheExpiryTime

hwMgmdRouterCacheIfIndex.description: The interface for which this entry contains information for an IP multicast group address.
hwMgmdRouterCacheIfIndex.name: hwMgmdRouterCacheIfIndex

hwMgmdRouterCacheLastReporter.description: The IP address of the source of the last membership report received for this IP multicast group address on this interface. If no membership report has been received, this object has the value 0. The InetAddressType, e.g., IPv4 or IPv6, is identified by the hwMgmdRouterCacheAddressType variable in the hwMgmdRouterCache table.
hwMgmdRouterCacheLastReporter.name: hwMgmdRouterCacheLastReporter

hwMgmdRouterCacheSourceFilterMode.description: The current cache state, applicable to MGMDv3 compatible nodes. The value indicates whether the state is INCLUDE or EXCLUDE.
hwMgmdRouterCacheSourceFilterMode.name: hwMgmdRouterCacheSourceFilterMode

hwMgmdRouterCacheTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the IP multicast groups for which there are members on a particular router interface.
hwMgmdRouterCacheTable.name: hwMgmdRouterCacheTable

hwMgmdRouterCacheUpTime.description: The time elapsed since this entry was created.
hwMgmdRouterCacheUpTime.name: hwMgmdRouterCacheUpTime

hwMgmdRouterCacheVersion1HostTimer.description: The time remaining until the local router will assume that there are no longer any MGMD version 1 members on the IP subnet attached to this interface. This entry only applies to IGMPv1 hosts, and is not implemented for MLD. Upon hearing any MGMDv1 Membership Report (IGMPv1 only), this value is reset to the group membership timer. While this time remaining is non-zero, the local router ignores any MGMDv2 Leave messages (IGMPv2 only) for this group that it receives on this interface.
hwMgmdRouterCacheVersion1HostTimer.name: hwMgmdRouterCacheVersion1HostTimer

hwMgmdRouterCacheVersion2HostTimer.description: The time remaining until the local router will assume that there are no longer any MGMD version 2 members on the IP subnet attached to this interface. This entry applies to both IGMP and MLD hosts. Upon hearing any MGMDv2 Membership Report, this value is reset to the group membership timer. Assuming no MGMDv1 hosts have been detected, the local router does not ignore any MGMDv2 Leave messages for this group that it receives on this interface.
hwMgmdRouterCacheVersion2HostTimer.name: hwMgmdRouterCacheVersion2HostTimer

hwMgmdRouterInterfaceEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) representing an interface on which IGMP or MLD is enabled.
hwMgmdRouterInterfaceEntry.name: hwMgmdRouterInterfaceEntry

hwMgmdRouterInterfaceGroups.description: The current number of entries for this interface in the RouterCache Table.
hwMgmdRouterInterfaceGroups.name: hwMgmdRouterInterfaceGroups

hwMgmdRouterInterfaceIfIndex.description: The ifIndex value of the interface for which IGMP or MLD is enabled. The table is indexed by the ifIndex value and the InetAddressType to allow for interfaces that may be configured in both IPv4 and IPv6 modes.
hwMgmdRouterInterfaceIfIndex.name: hwMgmdRouterInterfaceIfIndex

hwMgmdRouterInterfaceJoins.description: The number of times a group membership has been added on this interface, that is, the number of times an entry for this interface has been added to the Cache Table. This object can give an indication of the amount of activity between samples over time.
hwMgmdRouterInterfaceJoins.name: hwMgmdRouterInterfaceJoins

hwMgmdRouterInterfaceLastMembQueryCount.description: Represents the number of group-specific and group-and- source-specific queries sent by the router before it assumes there are no local members.
hwMgmdRouterInterfaceLastMembQueryCount.name: hwMgmdRouterInterfaceLastMembQueryCount

hwMgmdRouterInterfaceLastMembQueryIntvl.description: The Last Member Query Interval is the Max Query Response Interval inserted into group-specific queries sent in response to leave group messages, and is also the amount of time between group-specific query messages. This value may be tuned to modify the leave latency of the network. A reduced value results in reduced time to detect the loss of the last member of a group. The value of this object is irrelevant if hwMgmdRouterInterfaceVersion is 1.
hwMgmdRouterInterfaceLastMembQueryIntvl.name: hwMgmdRouterInterfaceLastMembQueryIntvl

hwMgmdRouterInterfaceProxyIfIndex.description: Some devices implement a form of IGMP or MLD proxying whereby memberships learned on the interface represented by this row cause Host Membership Reports to be sent on the interface whose ifIndex value is given by this object. Such a device would implement the hwMgmdV2RouterBaseMIBGroup only on its router interfaces (those interfaces with non-zero hwMgmdRouterInterfaceProxyIfIndex). Typically, the value of this object is 0, indicating that no proxying is being done.
hwMgmdRouterInterfaceProxyIfIndex.name: hwMgmdRouterInterfaceProxyIfIndex

hwMgmdRouterInterfaceQuerier.description: The address of the IGMP or MLD Querier on the IP subnet to which this interface is attached. The InetAddressType, e.g., IPv4 or IPv6, is identified by the hwMgmdRouterInterfaceQuerierType variable in the hwMgmdRouterInterface table.
hwMgmdRouterInterfaceQuerier.name: hwMgmdRouterInterfaceQuerier

hwMgmdRouterInterfaceQuerierExpiryTime.description: The amount of time remaining before the Other Querier Present Timer expires. If the local system is the querier, the value of this object is zero.
hwMgmdRouterInterfaceQuerierExpiryTime.name: hwMgmdRouterInterfaceQuerierExpiryTime

hwMgmdRouterInterfaceQuerierType.description: The address type of this interface. This entry along with the ifIndex value acts as the index to the hwMgmdRouterInterface table. A physical interface may be configured in multiple modes concurrently, e.g., in IPv4 and IPv6 modes connected to the same interface; however, the traffic is considered to be logically separate.
hwMgmdRouterInterfaceQuerierType.name: hwMgmdRouterInterfaceQuerierType

hwMgmdRouterInterfaceQuerierUpTime.description: The time since hwMgmdRouterInterfaceQuerier was last changed.
hwMgmdRouterInterfaceQuerierUpTime.name: hwMgmdRouterInterfaceQuerierUpTime

hwMgmdRouterInterfaceQueryInterval.description: The frequency at which IGMP or MLD Host-Query packets are transmitted on this interface.
hwMgmdRouterInterfaceQueryInterval.name: hwMgmdRouterInterfaceQueryInterval

hwMgmdRouterInterfaceQueryMaxResponseTim.description: The maximum query response interval advertised in MGMDv2 or IGMPv3 queries on this interface.
hwMgmdRouterInterfaceQueryMaxResponseTim.name: hwMgmdRouterInterfaceQueryMaxResponseTime

hwMgmdRouterInterfaceRobustness.description: The Robustness Variable allows tuning for the expected packet loss on a subnet. If a subnet is expected to be lossy, the Robustness Variable may be increased. IGMP and MLD are robust to (Robustness Variable-1) packet losses.
hwMgmdRouterInterfaceRobustness.name: hwMgmdRouterInterfaceRobustness

hwMgmdRouterInterfaceStartupQueryCount.description: Represents the number of Queries sent out on startup, separated by the Startup Query Interval.
hwMgmdRouterInterfaceStartupQueryCount.name: hwMgmdRouterInterfaceStartupQueryCount

hwMgmdRouterInterfaceStartupQueryInterva.description: This variable represents the interval between General Queries sent by a Querier on startup.
hwMgmdRouterInterfaceStartupQueryInterva.name: hwMgmdRouterInterfaceStartupQueryInterval

hwMgmdRouterInterfaceStatus.description: The activation of a row enables the router side of IGMP or MLD on the interface. The destruction of a row disables the router side of IGMP or MLD on the interface.
hwMgmdRouterInterfaceStatus.name: hwMgmdRouterInterfaceStatus

hwMgmdRouterInterfaceTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the interfaces on which IGMP or MLD is enabled.
hwMgmdRouterInterfaceTable.name: hwMgmdRouterInterfaceTable

hwMgmdRouterInterfaceVersion.description: The version of MGMD that is running on this interface. Value 1 applies to IGMPv1 routers only. Value 2 applies to IGMPv2 and MLDv1 routers, and value 3 applies to IGMPv3 and MLDv2 routers. This object can be used to configure a router capable of running either version. For IGMP and MLD to function correctly, all routers on a LAN must be configured to run the same version on that LAN.
hwMgmdRouterInterfaceVersion.name: hwMgmdRouterInterfaceVersion

hwMgmdRouterInterfaceWrongVersionQueries.description: The number of general queries received whose IGMP or MLD version does not match the equivalent hwMgmdRouterInterfaceVersion, over the lifetime of the row entry. Both IGMP and MLD require that all routers on a LAN be configured to run the same version. Thus, if any general queries are received with the wrong version, this indicates a configuration error.
hwMgmdRouterInterfaceWrongVersionQueries.name: hwMgmdRouterInterfaceWrongVersionQueries

hwMgmdRouterSrcListAddress.description: The IP multicast group address for which this entry contains information.
hwMgmdRouterSrcListAddress.name: hwMgmdRouterSrcListAddress

hwMgmdRouterSrcListAddressType.description: The address type of the InetAddress variables in this table. This value applies to the hwMgmdRouterSrcListHostAddress and hwMgmdRouterSrcListAddress entries.
hwMgmdRouterSrcListAddressType.name: hwMgmdRouterSrcListAddressType

hwMgmdRouterSrcListEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the hwMgmdRouterSrcListTable.
hwMgmdRouterSrcListEntry.name: hwMgmdRouterSrcListEntry

hwMgmdRouterSrcListExpire.description: This value indicates the relevance of the SrcList entry, whereby a non-zero value indicates this is an INCLUDE state value, and a zero value indicates this to be an EXCLUDE state value.
hwMgmdRouterSrcListExpire.name: hwMgmdRouterSrcListExpire

hwMgmdRouterSrcListHostAddress.description: The host address to which this entry corresponds. The hwMgmdRouterCacheSourceFilterMode value for this group address and interface indicates whether this host address is included or excluded.
hwMgmdRouterSrcListHostAddress.name: hwMgmdRouterSrcListHostAddress

hwMgmdRouterSrcListIfIndex.description: The interface for which this entry contains information for an IP multicast group address.
hwMgmdRouterSrcListIfIndex.name: hwMgmdRouterSrcListIfIndex

hwMgmdRouterSrcListTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the Source List entries corresponding to each interface and multicast group pair on a Router.
hwMgmdRouterSrcListTable.name: hwMgmdRouterSrcListTable

hwMgmdStdMib.contactinfo: Huawei Industrial Base Bantian, Longgang Shenzhen 518129 People's Republic of China Website: http://www.huawei.com Email: support@huawei.com
hwMgmdStdMib.description: The MIB module for MGMD Management. Huawei Technologies Co.,Ltd . Supplementary information may be available at: http://www.huawei.com
hwMgmdStdMib.name: hwMgmdStdMib

revisions.description: 1.Add hwMgmdHostStarGThresholdExceed trap. 2.Add hwMgmdHostStarGThresholdExceedClear trap. 3.Add hwMgmdHostStarGExceed trap. 4.Add hwMgmdHostStarGExceedClear trap. 5.Add hwMgmdHostSGThreshodExceed trap. 6.Add hwMgmdHostSGThreshodExceedClear trap. 7.Add hwMgmdHostSGExceed trap. 8.Add hwMgmdHostSGExceedClear trap.

1.Correct trap name hwMgmdTotalLimitThreshodExceed to hwMgmdTotalLimitThresholdExceed and modify the description. 2.Correct trap name hwMgmdTotalLimitThreshodExceedClear to hwMgmdTotalLimitThresholdExceedClear and modify the description.
The initial revision of this MIB module.

hwMgmdTotalEntries.description: The total number of IGMP or MLD entries of all instances.
hwMgmdTotalEntries.name: hwMgmdTotalEntries

hwMgmdTotalLimit.description: A hwMgmdTotalLimit notification signifies that an IGMP report has been limited for up to maximum entries of IGMP total routing-table. This notification is generated whenever an IGMP report failed to create membership as IGMP total routing-table limit.
hwMgmdTotalLimit.name: hwMgmdTotalLimit

hwMgmdTotalLimitCurrentCount.description: The current number of IGMP or MLD entries of all instances.
hwMgmdTotalLimitCurrentCount.name: hwMgmdTotalLimitCurrentCount

hwMgmdTotalLimitThreshold.description: The threshold value of IGMP or MLD entries uppper limit(%) of all instances.
hwMgmdTotalLimitThreshold.name: hwMgmdTotalLimitThreshold

hwMgmdTotalLimitThresholdExceed.description: A hwMgmdTotalLimitThresholdExceed notification signifies that IGMP or MLD entries count of all instances reached the upper threshold.
hwMgmdTotalLimitThresholdExceed.name: hwMgmdTotalLimitThresholdExceed

hwMgmdTotalLimitThresholdExceedClear.description: A hwMgmdTotalLimitThresholdExceedClear notification signifies that IGMP or MLD entries count of all instances fell below the lower threshold.
hwMgmdTotalLimitThresholdExceedClear.name: hwMgmdTotalLimitThresholdExceedClear

hwMgmdV2RouterOptMibGroup.description: An additional optional object for management of MGMD version 2 in routers.
